abstract: New York City Police Dept activity appears to be returning to normal after citywide slowdown since shooting deaths of officers Rafael Ramos and Wenjian Liu on Dec 20; arrests and tickets are sill at lower than normal levels and are being executed unevenly across city precincts, but are on the rise.
lead_paragraph: Arrests and tickets have yet to reach the same levels as in past years, but the rebound further indicates that a slowdown is over.
snippet: Arrests and tickets have yet to reach the same levels as in past years, but the rebound further indicates that a slowdown is over.

headline.main: Data Show New York Police Are Resuming Their Work
headline.print_headline: New City Data Show Officers Are Resuming Their Duties
